chinese: [U] the state of being an entrepreneur, or the activities or spirit associated with being an entrepreneur 企业家身份；企业家行为或精神
examples: e.g. Individuals not only need to examine their personal finances but also the considerable lifestyle changes [[entrepreneurship]] can bring.

chinese: [C] a new business activity that involves taking risks 风险项目；风险投资；冒险事业
examples: e.g. Another idea that has attracted [[venture]] capitalists' interest is online learning.

chinese: [C] general attitude to life and the world （对生活和世界的）看法，观点，态度
examples: e.g. You will become more mature as your [[outlook]] on life is influenced by the books that you read.

chinese: [U, sing.] the desire to know about sth. 好奇心
examples: e.g. In my view, intellectual [[curiosity]] is a sufficient reason for this new scientific endeavor.

chinese: 1) work hard to develop a particular skill, attitude, or quality 培养，养成（技能、态度或素质）
examples: e.g. [[Cultivating]] a positive mental attitude toward yourself can reap tremendous benefits.；e.g. Near the coast, huge areas of land are given over to [[cultivating]] tomatoes.

chinese: 2) prepare and use land for growing crops and plants 耕；耕作
examples: e.g. [[Cultivating]] a positive mental attitude toward yourself can reap tremendous benefits.；e.g. Near the coast, huge areas of land are given over to [[cultivating]] tomatoes.

chinese: considering a person or thing as a whole, rather than as separate parts 整体（论）的；全面的
examples: e.g. Policymakers need to take a long-term, [[holistic]] approach to the housing finance reform.

chinese: [U] the quality of being successful and working in the way that was intended 有效性
examples: e.g. There are doubts about the [[effectiveness]] of the new drug in treating the disease.

chinese: not involving anything or anyone else 唯一地；仅仅；独一无二地
examples: e.g. Too often we make buying decisions based [[solely]] upon what we see in advertisements.

chinese: [U] when a business or an activity makes a profit, or the amount of profit it makes 获利；盈利；利润
examples: e.g. Competition between firms will continue to force those prices down, which will undermine the [[profitability]] of the industry.

chinese: supporting or based on the principles of capitalism 资本主义的
examples: e.g. In a [[capitalistic]] society, individuals with wealth and privilege have much of the power.

chinese: (only before noun) introducing new and better methods or ideas for the first time 开创性的；先驱的；探索性的
examples: e.g. Cowley's [[pioneering]] development of modern emergency medicine helped save countless lives.

chinese: (BrE optimise) improve the way that sth. is done or used so that it is as effective as possible 使最优化；使尽可能完善；使尽量有效
examples: e.g. Doctors are concentrating on understanding the disease better, and on [[optimizing]] the treatment.

chinese: [C] a company, organization, or business 公司；组织；企业
examples: e.g. To a great many individuals setting up a new business [[enterprise]], the last thing they usually bother about is accounting and tax.

chinese: pleasing and satisfying 令人高兴的；令人满意的
examples: e.g. It must be very [[gratifying]] to see all your children grown-up and happy.

chinese: [U] the quality of being able to continue for a long time 可持续性
examples: e.g. "Do you want environmental [[sustainability]] or do you want economic advantage?" asked McConnell.

chinese: move, drive, or push sth. forward 推动；推进；驱动
examples: e.g. The rocket is attached to the spacecraft and is designed to [[propel]] it toward Mars.

chinese: completely new and different, esp. in a way that leads to great improvements 革命性的；突破性的；创新的
examples: e.g. The 20th century brought about [[revolutionary]] changes in our lifestyles.

chinese: [U, sing.] the importance of an event, action, etc., esp. because of the effect or influence it will have in the future 重要性，意义（尤指对将来的影响）
examples: e.g. The discovery of the new drug is of great [[significance]] for people suffering from heart problems.

chinese: [C] (the ~) the part of business activity that is concerned with buying and selling goods in competition with other companies 市场（指涉及营销的种种活动）
examples: e.g. Some retailers worry that new regulations will hurt their ability to compete in the [[marketplace]].

chinese: 1) a strong permanent influence on sb. / sth. 强大而持久的影响
examples: e.g. Gandhi was a tremendously brave man whose unique form of courage left a lasting [[imprint]] on India's history.；e.g. She could clearly see the [[imprint]] of her fingers on his pale wrist.

chinese: 2) the mark left by an object being pressed into or onto sth. 印记；压痕
examples: e.g. Gandhi was a tremendously brave man whose unique form of courage left a lasting [[imprint]] on India's history.；e.g. She could clearly see the [[imprint]] of her fingers on his pale wrist.

chinese: feeling sympathy for people who are suffering 充满同情心的；怜悯的
examples: e.g. The public's response to the crisis was generous and [[compassionate]].

chinese: [C] sth. that sb. has achieved that continues to exist after they stop working or die （某人不再工作或去世后）留下的成果
examples: e.g. Perhaps her most important [[legacy]] was her program of educational reform.

chinese: [U] a sensible and careful attitude that makes you avoid unnecessary risks 明智谨慎；慎重；审慎
examples: e.g. Businessmen are showing remarkable [[prudence]] in investing in the region.

chinese: finally, after everything else has been done or considered 最后；最终
examples: e.g. Everything will [[ultimately]] depend on what is said at the meeting with the directors next week.

chinese: if a fact, event, etc. implies sth., it shows that it is likely to be true 意味着（某事可能是真的）
examples: e.g. These findings do not [[imply]] that urbanization makes little or no difference to the small towns.

chinese: involving a combination of social and economic factors 社会经济的
examples: e.g. The age, education, and [[socioeconomic]] status of these young mothers led to less satisfactory childcare.

chinese: understand sth. that is complicated or difficult 理解，领悟（复杂或困难的事物）
examples: e.g. In an effort to [[comprehend]] the principles of investment of any sort, you have to know the way to determine the return on investment.

chinese: extremely large 巨大的；极大的
examples: e.g. Regular visits from a social worker can be of [[immense]] value to elderly people living alone.

chinese: 1) (fml.) have a particular quality or ability 拥有，具有（某品质或能力）
examples: e.g. I'm afraid he doesn't [[possess]] a sense of humor.；e.g. Because of his gambling, he lost everything he [[possessed]].

chinese: 2) (fml.) have or own sth. 拥有，持有（某物）
examples: e.g. I'm afraid he doesn't [[possess]] a sense of humor.；e.g. Because of his gambling, he lost everything he [[possessed]].

chinese: (fml.) ask for sth. in an emotional way 恳求；乞求；哀求
examples: e.g. If you feel depressed for more than three weeks, I [[implore]] you to seek professional help.

chinese: (BrE revolutionise) completely change the way people do sth. or think about sth. 使彻底变革；给···带来革命
examples: e.g. The company [[revolutionized]] the market for watches with its inexpensive watches aimed at the youth market.

chinese: (the ~) (fml.) the second of two people or things just mentioned （刚提及的两个人或物中的）后者
examples: e.g. Where unemployment and crime are high, it can be assumed that the [[latter]] is due to the former.

chinese: developing well and being successful 繁荣的；兴旺的；成功的
examples: e.g. A stable and [[flourishing]] economy is essential for political stability and national security, and vice versa.

chinese: unwilling to change ideas or behavior 顽固的；僵化的
examples: e.g. We were disappointed that they insisted on such a [[rigid]] interpretation of the rules.

chinese: (usu. before noun) very careful and thorough 小心的；费尽心思的；精心的
examples: e.g. It is the kind of [[painstaking]] work that only someone who knows every inch of the ship could perform.

chinese: [C, U] quality, ability, or achievement that is average or below average 普通；平庸；平常
examples: e.g. We will not accept [[mediocrity]]; the job they do is of critical importance.

chinese: 1) (~ to sb. / sth.) strange and frightening; different from what you are used to 陌生的；不熟悉的
examples: e.g. In a world that had suddenly become [[alien]] and dangerous, Michael was her only security.；e.g. In short, he concluded that the canals were artificial constructs of technologically advanced [[alien]] beings.

chinese: 2) connected with creatures from another world 外星的
examples: e.g. In a world that had suddenly become [[alien]] and dangerous, Michael was her only security.；e.g. In short, he concluded that the canals were artificial constructs of technologically advanced [[alien]] beings.

chinese: find out about sth. that has been kept secret 发现；揭露
examples: e.g. The investigation [[uncovered]] evidence of a large-scale illegal trade in wild birds.

chinese: very important or serious, esp. because there may be important results 关键的；重大的；重要的
examples: e.g. Whether or not to move overseas is a [[momentous]] decision for the family.

chinese: be caused by sth. or start from sth. 由···引起
examples: e.g. His grief sprang from the loss of the most important love he had ever known in his life.

chinese: show clearly that sth. happened or exists 表明；说明
examples: e.g. Her skin spoke of warm summer days spent in the sun.

chinese: do or discover sth. new 开辟新天地；创新
examples: e.g. Inventing such a camera wouldn't be easy, but Cameron said he was ready to break new ground.

chinese: 约翰 • 凯奇（美国音乐家）
邵逸夫（中国香港企业家、慈善家）
